publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2958 Murdo Fraser: Fire Safety at the Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldyâ€”That the Parliament, in light of the recent decision by the Fife NHS Board to centralise acute services in the Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy, and fears expressed by members of the public in relation to fire safety at the hospital, calls upon the Scottish Executive to instigate an investigation by the Health and Safety Authority and the Fife Fire Service of the fire safety precautions and other risks at the Victoria Hospital to ensure that, in the event of any outbreak of fire, there is no risk to patients, visitors and staff, and further calls for any report from such an investigation be made public through the Parliament. Supported by: Alex Johnstone*, Mr David Davidson*, Ben Wallace*, Mr Keith Harding*
S1M-2958 Fire Safety at the Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy (lodged on 28 March 2002) Tricia Marwick*
